content.text:
I'll start by exploring the codebase to understand the project structure and current state.
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros -type f -name "*.md" | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cat /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/README.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">git -C /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros log --oneline -10</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros -type f \( -name "*.c" -o -name "*.h" -o -name "*.asm" -o -name "*.s" \) | head -20</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">tree -L 3 /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros -I 'node_modules|.git' 2>/dev/null || find /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros -maxdepth 3 -type d | sort</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me get a better picture of the project structure:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">ls -la /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/src/ 2>/dev/null || echo "No src directory"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cat /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/Makefile 2>/dev/null | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros -maxdepth 2 -type f | grep -E "\.(c|h|asm|s|rs|ts|js)$"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

Let me check the project documentation:
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cat /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros/TODO.md 2>/dev/null | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">find /home/razz/src/razza/clankeros -name "*.md" -exec echo "=== {} ===" \; -exec head -30 {} \;</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

## Project Overview

Based on my exploration, **ClankerOS** is an operating system project with the following characteristics:

### Current State:
- **Type**: Bare-metal x86 kernel development project
- **Recent Work**: 
  - Multiboot header and kernel entry point implementation
  - GDT (Global Descriptor Table), IDT (Interrupt Descriptor Table), ISR (Interrupt Service Routines), and early console support
  - Documentation website infrastructure
  - Coding style guide established

### Architecture:
The project appears to be a low-level systems programming project implementing:
- Boot loader support (Multiboot compliant)
- CPU initialization (GDT, IDT)
- Interrupt handling (ISRs)
- Early console/logging capabilities
- Documentation infrastructure

### Development Status:
- Main branch is clean (no uncommitted changes)
- Active development with recent commits focused on core kernel infrastructure
- Has established coding standards and documentation practices

### What I'm Ready to Help With:

I'm now prepared to assist with implementation planning for any new features or improvements to the ClankerOS project. Please provide:

1. **Specific Requirements**: What new feature or improvement you want to implement
2. **Context**: Any particular area of the kernel you want to focus on
3. **Constraints**: Any specific requirements (performance, compatibility, etc.)

Once you provide the requirements, I can:
- Explore existing patterns and code
- Design a detailed implementation plan
- Identify critical files for modification
- Outline the step-by-step approach
- Anticipate challenges and trade-offs

What would you like me to help plan next?
